paper_abstract: The characterization of the class of FO[+]-definable languages by some generating or recognizing device is still an open problem. We prove that, restricted to word bounded languages, this class coincides with the class of semilinear languages. We also study the closure properties of the classes of languages definable in FO[+1], FO[<], FO[+] and FOC[+] under the main classical operations.
paper_title: First-order logics: some characterizations and closure properties
